sentences.english: Fetus already have hearing now and you can begin a prenatal education.
sentences.chinese: 胎儿已具备听力，能听见声音，可开始进行胎教了。

sentences.english: To explore the effect of foetus education musical stimulate on infant development quotient.
sentences.chinese: 了解胎教音乐刺激对婴幼儿发育商的影响。

sentences.english: Is how I would begin four months of prenatal education.
sentences.chinese: 我就是从四个月开始进行胎教的。

sentences.english: The Ritmo is exactly as described and pictured.
sentences.chinese: 天才宝宝胎教仪和照片及网上的描述完全一样。

sentences.english: Music prenatal education is now increasingly accepted.
sentences.chinese: 现在音乐胎教正日益为人们所接受。

sentences.english: Prenatal education has been a dedicated music recording tape listed.
sentences.chinese: 现已有专门的胎教音乐录音磁带上市。

sentences.english: In addition, the high IQ group in the majority of children prenatal care.
sentences.chinese: 另外，智商高分组中胎教儿童占绝大多数。

sentences.english: This all leads scientists to believe that the process of learning language may begin before birth.
sentences.chinese: 这说明科学家有理由相信胎教对语言的学习有帮助。

sentences.english: Only the music for mother and fetus can only be called prenatal music.
sentences.chinese: 只有适合母亲和胎儿的音乐才可以称为胎教音乐。

definition: early education (abbr. for 早期教育[zao3 qi1 jiao4 yu4])
to give birth without complications/easy childbirth/safe delivery/natural birth (without surgical operation)
a mom (mother of a young child)
